Pat Farrell wrote:
> Hi,
> I've got about 250 JUnit tests so far for my little system, and
> it is working great. But....
> 
> I've got two flavors to test. one with a real JDCB database
> connection, and a fake-connection one for when there
> is no SQL database to connect to.
> 
> These are controlled by a property and there is a singleton
> instance containing all the properties.
> 

Sounds like it's time to refactor so this isn't a problem. Make it a 
runtime configurable option, instead of something controlled by a 
property file. They're probably a few design patterns like abstract 
factory that might help out here.
